item.title: Once Human: All Rare Plants & Where to Find Them
item.description:
In Once Human , survival depends on mastering essential skills like taming animals, farming crops, and cooking your own food. Food items require lots of different ingredients, including rare plants that you may not come across normally. Apart from restoring hunger and hydration meters, food also provides you with quick buffs that can make your journey in Once Human easier. To avoid missing out on these benefits, you need to learn how to efficiently farm rare plants.

All Rare Plants In Once Human

The table below comprises a list of some of the rarest plants in Once Human , along with details of where you can find them and their uses.

Plant Name

Where to Find

Uses

Aloe Vera

Found spawning near the Teleportation Tower, southeast of Blackfell.

  • Used in making Honey Glazed Meat, Stargazy Pizza, and
  • Signature Ice Brew.

Banana

Chop banana trees in Dayton Wetlands and Broken Delta.

Used in making the Anti-Gravity Milkshake which increases your Max Load, allowing you to carry more resources for a short period of time.

Cucumber

Purchase cucumber seeds from Zhao Jintan’s shop in the Meyer’s Market and grow them on your territory.

Used in making the Signature Ice Brew drink that increases your Pollution Resistance by 30% and, Sanity recovery speed outside of combat.

Coconut

Cut coconut palm trees found on Broken Delta beaches and around the Teleportation Tower near Sunbury Middle School.

Used in making Assorted Canned Fruit that increases Weakspot damage by 25% when Sanity is above 80%.

Grapes

Forage bushes in the Iron River area and around Teleportation Towers, especially in Chalk Peak.

Used in making Orange Pie, it gives you a 25% XP boost against enemies for 30 minutes.

Morel

Loot supply crates, trash cans, metal cabinets, and drawers in high-level areas like Red Sand to find Morel seeds and plant them at your base.

Used in making Borscht Deluxe, which doubles the amount of Energy Links you get by opening weapon and gear crates.

Peppercorn

Purchase Peppercorn or peppercorn seeds from Lacey’s shop at the Blackfell encampment in Red Sands.

Used in making Securement Soup, which increases chances of successful Deviation Securement by 50%.

Onion

Purchase onion seeds from Emma Potter’s shop at Tall Grass Inn in Chalk Peak and grow them on your territory.

It can be mutated into a unique combat deviant called Grumpy Bulb. This deviant causes enemies to turn on each other.

Tomato

Purchase tomato seeds from Johnathan’s shop in Greywater Camp in Iron River and grow them on your territory.

Used in making the Signature Ice Brew drink that increases your Pollution Resistance by 30% and, Sanity recovery speed outside of combat.

Mutated versions of regular crops, called Deviated Crops in Once Human , are also used in making special recipes that can provide various buffs.

item.title: 6 Best Horror Game DLC, Ranked
item.description:
Few video game genres immerse players like horror games . These popular titles dare the player to continue, with tense nightmare worlds filled with demons, killers, and monsters. The genre is filled with classics; games that stand the test of time and are played as much now as on release.

Developers often release DLC content to help continue a game’s shelf life. While some expansions offer small upgrades, such as new weapons, enemies, or skins to the base game, some DLC content includes a lot more. Some of the best expansions bring new levels, stories, and characters to the game. They expand on the game’s lore and world, providing hours of additional content for gamers to enjoy.

6 Dead Space 3 - Awakened

A Short Return To Horror

The Dead Space series became a highly regarded addition to the horror genre. It followed Isaac Clarke’s struggles with the terrifying Necromorphs and the Markers that made them, bringing players into a gruesome nightmare of bodily dismemberment. While the first two games included some heart-pounding action sequences, they were still horror games at heart. Dead Space 3 changed this, leaning more into the action, with the horror coming a close second.

While this broadened the spectrum of players, many Dead Space fans were disappointed in the game's direction. Dead Space 3 ’s DLC, Awakened , for many, was how the base game should have been. Leaning more into the horror that made Dead Space such a memorable moment in gaming. Awakened follows Isaac Clarke and John Carver as they escape on the ship, Terra Nova. While this DLC is criminally short, fans of the first two Dead Space games will enjoy this worthy addition to the series.

5 The Last of Us - Left Behind

An Immersive and Emotional Backstory

The Last Of Us quickly became one of the most critically acclaimed video games of all time. Its blend of survival horror, stealth action, and emotional storytelling captivated players around the world. Its stunning DLC release, Left Behind , was a perfect companion to the base game, telling a self-contained story that links in with the main narrative.

Left Behind is set both during and before the main storyline and blends a touching tale of first love in a post-apocalyptic world with stealth horror gameplay. The expansion cuts between Ellie’s struggle to keep Joel alive after being fatally wounded and the story of how she was bitten in the first place. Left Behind continues The Last of Us's high level of gameplay and narrative storytelling. This creates an expansion that fits perfectly with the story and characters portrayed in the game.

4 Dying Light - The Following

A New Location Brings New Mechanics

Dying Light is an open-world action horror game, where players explore the quarantined city of Harran. The city is ground zero for a terrible zombie outbreak, where the few survivors hide in the ruins of their destroyed city. While leaning heavily into the action side of horror, Dying Light is a fun, fast-paced game that found a loyal fanbase.

Its fantastic DLC changes things up, bringing a fresh story, with a new large-scale map. Set just outside the city limits, The Following continues the story of Kyle Crane as he investigates a possible cure for the zombie virus. The DLC opens up the gameplay, introducing wide open spaces filled with hordes of zombies that players can mow down in customizable dune buggies. The Following is a brilliant addition to Dying Light , with an interesting and engaging story, a welcome location change, and fun new vehicles and weapons to use.

3 Alien: Isolation - Crew Expendable

A Welcome Return to the Nostromo

Alien: Isolation arguably set a new standard for survival horror. Its stunning recreation of the original movie’s design was beaten only by its tense atmosphere and groundbreaking AI technology. In the game, the Xenomorph actively hunts the player, learning and adapting to the movement and sound the player makes. This creates constant tension, as the Alien is never far away.

Alien: Isolation was already set to go down as a classic, and its brilliant expansion only confirmed this. Crew Expendable takes players into an alternate narrative of the original movie. Set soon after the Alien has burst bloodily forth, the crew of the Nostromo formulate a plan to flush it out. With Alien: Isolation taking so much influence from the 1979 movie, this nostalgic DLC is the perfect partner to one of the best survival horror games ever made.

2 Resident Evil 7: Biohazard - End of Zoe

A Perfect Punch To End A Great Game

With Resident Evil 7 , the long-running horror franchise once again reinvented itself by leaning heavily into its survival horror roots. With this new perspective, and a new protagonist, Resident Evil 7 reasserted its dominance in the horror gaming industry. The game follows Ethan Winters as he investigates the disappearance of his girlfriend. Finding himself trapped in a broken and rotting home, and hunted by the deranged Baker family, the game is a heart-pounding blend of horror and action.

The excellent DLC, End of Zoe , leans heavily into the setting and follows Joe Baker as he attempts to save his niece, Zoe, after the events of the main game. This brilliant DLC expands on the lore of the Baker family while introducing fun new mechanics to the game. Joe Baker is a no-nonsense, ex-marine, who talks more with his fists than words. Players get to run around the swamps feeling almost unstoppable as Joe, quite literally, fist-fights his way through the many monsters trying to stop him.

1 Outlast - Whistleblower

A Chilling Companion To The Classic Survival Horror

Outlast is widely regarded as one of the best survival horror titles in modern gaming. While not subtle in its scares, the game follows an investigative reporter as he becomes trapped in a dangerous asylum, filled with deformed and deranged killers. Players have no weaponry and must use their camera’s night vision to proceed through the pitch-black corridors.

The game's DLC, Whistleblower, works as a companion story, following the character Waylon Park, a software engineer working at Mount Massive. The expansion works as a prequel to the events of the game but then continues past, revealing itself to be a sequel. This slots the DLC in perfectly with the main narrative, making it a must-play addition for fans who enjoyed Outlast and are looking for more.

item.title: Clash Royale: The Best Cards for Beginners
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Fireball provides versatile utility against enemies and buildings, a solid inclusion in beginner decks.
  • Zap offers instant, affordable stun and damage, synergizing well with other spells in a beginner deck.
  • Arrows deliver powerful area damage but require strategic timing due to slower speed and higher cost.

With over a hundred cards, Clash Royale boasts one of the most extensive rosters among similar games. While this variety enhances the game's engagement and fun, it can be overwhelming for newcomers. One common question among beginners is: Which cards are ideal for a starter deck ? To address this, let's go through the nine most effective beginner cards across Common and Rare categories that players can unlock early in the game.

Clash Royale Beginner Card Tier List

The following table is a quicker way to find the best beginner cards in Clash Royale . It divides the most beginner-friendly cards into four tiers: S+, S, A, and B.

Tier

Cards

S+

Musketeer, Knight

S

Mini P.E.K.K.A., Giant

A

Arrows, Bomber, Archers

B

Fireball, Zap

9 Fireball

Best Property: Knockback and Versatility

  • Elixir Cost : 4
  • Rarity : Rare
  • How to Get : Training Camp

Fireball is an iconic card in Clash Royale , one that most beginners tend to spam during their early days. However, there’s a reason why this spell remains popular, even among veteran players. Fireball provides consistent utility in several strategic maneuvers:

  1. It can finish off weakened enemies or destroy low-HP buildings.
  2. It can knock back offensive enemy troops or redirect their attack route.
  3. It can wipe out swarms before they even cross the bridge.

While Fireball might eventually be overshadowed by more powerful cards unlocked at higher levels, it remains a versatile and reliable option. Despite being a low-tier beginner card, Fireball is still a solid addition to most decks, regardless of their archetype or play style.

8 Zap

Best Property: Agility and Cost-effectiveness

  • Elixir Cost : 2
  • Rarity : Common
  • How to Get : Builder’s Workshop

Zap is like a mini version of Arrows, offering a quick, instant effect that beginners will find invaluable. Its immediate stun, combined with moderate area-of-effect (AoE) damage, can hold back enemy troops, soften them up, and set them up to be finished off by other offensive units. Moreover, Zap is cheaper to deploy than comparable cards like Arrows, making it an affordable and efficient tech option.

What sets Zap apart is its consistent synergy with other spell cards like Fireball and Poison, making it a strong candidate for beginner decks. Additionally, Zap serves as a reliable reinforcement for low-HP, high-damage troops, giving them the buffer they need to land a decisive blow.

7 Arrows

Best Property: Area of Effect

  • Elixir Cost : 3
  • Rarity : Common
  • How to Get : Training Camp

Arrows might be replaceable with better spell cards at higher ranks, but for a beginner in Clash Royale , it's an essential deck component. This card offers powerful area-of-effect (AoE) damage, capable of wiping out both aerial and ground swarms. To highlight its effectiveness, Arrows can eliminate Minions that are five levels higher—a significant advantage in many situations.

However, Arrows come with a few drawbacks, which is why they don't rank higher on the list. The card is relatively slow and costly. When summoned, Arrows take a few seconds to reach their target, requiring the player to anticipate the enemy’s movement—a skill that may not come naturally to beginners. Additionally, Arrows demand more Elixir than similar options like Zap, which can make them a less economical choice for some decks.

Arrows were nerfed during Season 62's final balance change.

6 Bomber

Best Property: Destructibility

  • Elixir Cost : 2
  • Rarity : Common
  • How to Get : Bone Pit

The Bomber might not be perceived as a deadly drop due to his limited area of effect, but he stands out as one of the most effective early-game units. His high damage output allows him to neutralize enemy solo attackers with ease, making him a reliable choice for beginners.

Bomber excels at taking down ground swarms on his own, effortlessly clearing the battlefield of weaker units. When paired with cards like Ice Golem, he transforms into a formidable secondary damage dealer, significantly boosting the deck's overall destructibility.

However, Bomber's downside — and the reason he's not ranked higher — is his vulnerability. He's easy to counter, as most single-target drops with moderate damage can eliminate him with minimal risk, making it crucial to deploy him strategically to maximize his impact.

5 Archers

Best Property: Versatile Synergies

  • Elixir Cost : 3
  • Rarity : Common
  • How to Get : Training Camp

Archers are a staple in many beginner decks, and for good reason. They offer valuable aerial support and deal solid damage to ground troops. For new players, Archers are particularly essential as they effectively counter one of the early metagame's biggest threats: the Balloon. By deploying Archers, players can protect their troops from the Balloon's air-to-ground assault, which can significantly impact the outcome of a match.

For those aiming to maintain an offensive strategy, pairing Archers with tank cards is a strategic choice. The tank absorbs the initial damage, allowing Archers to focus on eliminating key targets without taking too much damage themselves.

4 Mini P.E.K.K.A.

Best Property: Defense-Offense Balance

  • Elixir Cost : 4
  • Rarity : Rare
  • How to Get : Training Camp

Utilized as a budget tank, Mini P.E.K.K.A. is one of the most versatile cards in Clash Royale . It excels as both a tank counter and a solo destroyer. Mini P.E.K.K.A. is agile, durable, and highly effective against heavy troops like the Giant. When paired with support cards that provide large-area damage, Mini P.E.K.K.A. can become a formidable force on the battlefield.

However, Mini P.E.K.K.A.'s primary drawback is its vulnerability to swarms. Without any area-of-effect attacks, it struggles against groups of enemies such as Skeleton Army or Royal Recruits, making it easy to counter with these types of cards.

3 Giant

Best Property: Targeted DMG

  • Elixir Cost : 5
  • Rarity : Rare
  • How to Get : Training Camp

No beginner Clash Royale deck is complete without the Giant. This tanky unit serves as a reliable win condition when used offensively, but it also has defensive utility. What makes the Giant a solid card is his targeted damage: he specifically attacks buildings. With this ability, the Giant becomes a primary tower damage dealer. Additionally, players can deploy the Giant near their own towers to distract enemy units and draw them away from the Crown Tower.

Here are two effective strategies for using the Giant:

  • Using Giant as a Shield : The Giant can protect low-HP, high-damage units, providing them with the extra time they need to eliminate targets.
  • Reinforcing Giant’s Destructibility : When combined with cards like Balloon, the Giant can deal significantly more damage and become a more formidable force.

2 Musketeer

Best Property: Long-range DMG

  • Elixir Cost : 4
  • Rarity : Rare
  • How to Get : Training Camp

An often overlooked unit in many beginner decks, the Musketeer is actually one of the best cards in Clash Royale . She offers excellent synergy with most ground-to-ground offensive strategies and provides reliable firepower from a safe distance. The Musketeer is invaluable for protecting friendly ground troops from aerial counterattacks, as she can hit targets from six tiles away.

What makes the Musketeer a highly strategic card is her ability to chip away at the opponent’s HP without being directly engaged in the battle. Pro players often place her away from the crowded bridge, allowing her to provide supportive cannonball-like firepower to the units actively engaging the enemy.

1 Knight

Best Property: Cost-Effective Tank Stats

  • Elixir Cost : 3
  • Rarity : Common
  • How to Get : Training Camp

The Knight is the best beginner card in Clash Royale due to its sheer utility. Whether used as a frontline offense unit or a backline defense option, the Knight is a versatile and reliable choice. As a low-cost tank, he can effectively shield ranged attackers, giving them time to inflict more damage. Additionally, he excels in one-on-one combat, capable of taking down formidable foes like the Prince and Giant Skeleton.

While the Knight is highly effective overall, there are a few scenarios where his utility may be limited. Despite his strength as a solo attacker—where he can chip away at half of an enemy’s Crown Tower HP—he is somewhat vulnerable to horde attackers. Swarms can overwhelm and take down the Knight relatively quickly, although he can still one-shot Goblins of his level.

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong – All Drink Locations
item.description:
Every drink in Black Myth: Wukong provides a different effect apart from the healing. Some drinks heal more, but their added effect might not be great. The drinks of higher rarity have more slots for Soaks, so players can get a lot of options when choosing which to equip.

Collecting all the drinks is also mandatory if players aim to earn the Brewer's Bounty Trophy/Achievement or go for 100%. Players who are confused about where to find the few drinks that have been missed can check out the guide below with all the locations of the drinks in Black Myth: Wukong .

All Drinks In Black Myth: Wukong

There are nine drinks that players can acquire throughout the game, including the one they start with.

Drinks

Image

Location

Jade Dew

This is the upgraded version of the starting drink you get in the first chapter.

Lambbrew

This is the first drink you can pick, located at the start of the second chapter. You can head up the right path from where you started the chapter. If you missed it and made it to the Village Entrance Keeper's Shrine, head back the way you came, and you will notice a small wooden bridge on the body of water you can cross and reach the other side. Keep going up this path past the archer, and there should be an open entrance that you can go through to find the Lambbrew at the end.

Bluebridge Romance

For the Bluebridge Romance, you must progress through the third chapter until you reach the North Shore of the Bitter Lake Keeper's Shrine. Turn around and head to the area where you fought Chen Loong . There should be a path on the right of the house that you need to take. If this is your first time here, you will see an NPC calling out for help, and you can deal with the three enemies ahead of him. This is the start of the Treasure Hunter quest, which rewards you with the Spell Binder Spell at the end. After interacting with the NPC, head left and cross the water body to the other side to find the drink.

Jade Essence

The Jade Essence Drink is behind the Old Ginseng Guai boss near the Towers of Karma Keeper's Shrine. To reach this Shrine, players must reach the Forest of Felicity and take the path to the left through the wooden Tori gate. As you reach the third Tori gate on this path, go right instead of going through the gate. There will be a few enemies here, but they do not chase you for long, so you can run past them and head for the Keeper's Shrine on the slightly left path.

Pinebrew

You can purchase this drink from the Shen Monkey at the start of the fourth chapter. The Shen Monkey is located in Bamboo Grove but moves to the Zodiac Village if you have completed Chen Loong's quest.

Worryfree Brew

The Worryfree Brew Drink is inside a house with three cocoons blocking the entrance. From the Middle Hollow Keeper's Shrine, turn around, go straight, and turn right into the area with the cocoons. Turn left up ahead and cross the bridge to reach the house. Alternatively, you can get to this house from the Verdure Bridge by going into the hole in front of you and past the Scorpion Prince Spirit to reach a wooden bridge right before the house.

Sunset of the Nine Skies

From the Court of Illumation Keeper's Shrine, go down the stairs, head straight, and towards the doorway to the far left. Keep following this path until you can turn left. Go up the two sets of stairs and turn right. At the end of this path, you will find the drink on a table. There is also a boss fight with the Fungiwoman if you gather the mushrooms in this area.

Loong Balm

After the fight with the Keeper of Flaming Mountains and Yin-Yang Fish inside the Emerald Hall , look ahead to where the Mother sat during the cutscene to find the Loong Balm right before you.

A Thousand Days Inebriation

You can purchase this drink from the Shen Monkey at the start of the sixth chapter.

The Coconut Wine Drink is the starting drink, and players can upgrade this at the Shen Monkey using Awaken Wine Worms. The more the drink is upgraded, the more healing it provides, and the slots for Soaks increase.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for September 2, 2024
item.description:
Strands has a whole grid filled with words that follow a specific theme. It's your job to figure out the theme and find all eight words inside the letter grid while using every single letter only once. While you can charge up some hints by finding non-themed words hidden in the puzzle, sometimes a puzzle just has you completely stumped.

If you are stuck on the September 2, 2024, brain-teaser and need more than the occasional hint the rules of Strands allow for, you can find a bunch of helpful tips below. In this article, there are general clues, some spoilers, and even the full answer to the puzzle if you want to see it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #183 September 2, 2024

The September 2, 2024, Strands puzzle has the clue Order in the Court! It has eight total things to find: one Spangram category and seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If a couple of clues with no spoilers in them would help you solve this mobile puzzle game, check out the three sections below. Each one has a spoiler-free hint that will get you thinking about the theme in a slightly different way.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Each of the two expandable sections below has one spoiled word along with a screenshot of where it goes in puzzle's grid. To uncover them, press the Read More button underneath each.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The full answer to this New York Times Games puzzle game is in the section below. Inside the covered-up section will be a list of all the hidden words, the Spangram, and a screenshot of a completed version of this browser-based puzzle game.

Today's Strands Explained

The expandable section below has an explanation for this mobile puzzle game similar to Wordle and the clue. If you want to understand the theme better and how it relates to the clue and the themed words, take a peek inside.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.
